title: Lewandowski accuses Democrats of ‘petty and personal politics’ in contentious House hearing
text:
Former Trump campaign manager Corey Lewandowski is charging that House Democrats are “going down rabbit holes” and “focusing on petty and personal politics” while testifying at what the committee is calling its first impeachment hearing.

Lewandowski said investigations of President Donald Trump have been “populated by many Trump haters who had their own agenda — to take down a duly elected president of the United States.”

Pablo Martinez Monsivais President Donald Trump smiles after listening to Corey Lewandowski, a former manager of Trump's presidential campaign, deliver remarks at a rally this April in Michigan.

House Democrats have called Lewandowski to testify about topics addressed in former special counsel Robert Mueller’s report on Russia’s attack on the 2016 presidential election. Mueller’s investigators detailed episodes in which Trump asked Lewandowski to direct then–Attorney General Jeff Sessions to limit Mueller’s investigation. Mueller said his report would have exonerated Trump on obstruction of justice if it could have done so.

Lewandowski said there’s been “harassment of the president from the day he won the election.”

Trump, in a tweet, characterized Lewandowski’s opening statement at the hearing as “beautiful”:

Trump Today: Trump teases quick China trade deal, downplays need to tap SPR after attack on Saudi oil, applauds former campaign manager Lewandowski’s congressional testimony
description: The former Trump campaign manager is appearing Tuesday at what the House Judiciary Committee has labeled its first impeachment hearing.
